title: Creating Your First Django Project
description: Setting up the blog project structure and understanding Django's project layout
content:
Creating Your First Django Project

Now that Django is installed, let's create our blog project from scratch.

Step 1: Create the Project

With your virtual environment activated, create a new Django project:

django-admin startproject myblog
cd myblog

Step 2: Understanding Project Structure

Django creates several files and folders:

myblog/
├── manage.py
└── myblog/
    ├── __init__.py
    ├── settings.py
    ├── urls.py
    ├── wsgi.py
    └── asgi.py
  • manage.py - Command-line utility for interacting with your project
  • settings.py - Configuration for your Django project
  • urls.py - URL routing for the project
  • wsgi.py - WSGI configuration for deployment
  • asgi.py - ASGI configuration for async deployment

Step 3: Run the Development Server

Test that everything works:

python manage.py runserver

Visit http://127.0.0.1:8000/ - you should see Django's welcome page!

Step 4: Create the Blog App

Django projects contain multiple apps. Let's create our blog app:

python manage.py startapp blog

This creates a new folder:

blog/
├── __init__.py
├── admin.py
├── apps.py
├── migrations/
├── models.py
├── tests.py
└── views.py

Step 5: Register the App

Add your app to INSTALLED_APPS in settings.py:

INSTALLED_APPS = [
    'django.contrib.admin',
    'django.contrib.auth',
    'django.contrib.contenttypes',
    'django.contrib.sessions',
    'django.contrib.messages',
    'django.contrib.staticfiles',
    'blog',  # Add this line
]

Congratulations! You now have a Django project with a blog app ready for development.

cd myblog
